statement:
If $A_i, B_i, C_i$, for $i=1,2,3$ are objects of an abelian category
such that there is a commutative diagram $$\xymatrix{
 & 0\ar[d]&0\ar[d]&0\ar[d]&\\
0\ar[r] & A_1\ar[r]\ar[d]&B_1\ar[r]\ar[d]&C_1\ar[r]\ar[d]&0\\
0\ar[r] & A_2\ar[r]\ar[d]&B_2\ar[r]\ar[d]&C_2\ar[r]\ar[d]&0\\
0\ar[r] & A_3\ar[r]\ar[d]&B_3\ar[r]\ar[d]&C_3\ar[r]\ar[d]&0\\
  & 0 & 0 & 0 &}$$ with the columns and bottom two rows are exact, then
the top row is exact as well.
